question: Match the following:
column_II: By spores called conidia or sporangiospores or zoospores
Various spores are produced in distinct structures called fruiting bodies

matches.Asexual reproduction: By spores called conidia or sporangiospores or zoospores

matches.Fruiting bodies: Various spores are produced in distinct structures called fruiting bodies

answer: Vegetative means - Fragmentation, fission and budding, Asexual reproduction - By spores called conidia or sporangiospores or zoospores, Sexual reproduction - By oospores, ascospores and basidiospores, Fruiting bodies - Various spores are produced in distinct structures called fruiting bodies

question: Match the following:
column_II: Fusion of protoplasms between two motile or non-motile gametes

matches.Plasmogamy: Fusion of protoplasms between two motile or non-motile gametes

answer: Plasmogamy - Fusion of protoplasms between two motile or non-motile gametes, Karyogamy - Fusion of two nuclei, Meiosis in zygote - Resulting in haploid spores, Dikaryon - Two nuclei per cell (n + n)

question: Match the following:
column_I: Immediate fusion of two haploid cells resulting in diploid cells (2n)
column_II: Such a condition is called a dikaryon
Occurs in fruiting bodies leading to haploid spores

matches.Dikaryophase: Such a condition is called a dikaryon

matches.Reduction division: Occurs in fruiting bodies leading to haploid spores

answer: Immediate fusion of two haploid cells resulting in diploid cells (2n) - In some fungi, Intervening dikaryotic stage occurs - Occurs in ascomycetes and basidiomycetes, Dikaryophase - Such a condition is called a dikaryon, Reduction division - Occurs in fruiting bodies leading to haploid spores

question: Match the following:
column_I: Basis for division of the kingdom into various classes
column_II: Mode of spore formation, morphology of the mycelium and fruiting bodies
In aquatic habitats and on decaying wood in moist and damp places or as obligate parasites on plants

matches.Basis for division of the kingdom into v: Mode of spore formation, morphology of the mycelium and fruiting bodies

matches.Members of phycomycetes are found: In aquatic habitats and on decaying wood in moist and damp places or as obligate parasites on plants

answer: Basis for division of the kingdom into various classes - Mode of spore formation, morphology of the mycelium and fruiting bodies, Members of phycomycetes are found - In aquatic habitats and on decaying wood in moist and damp places or as obligate parasites on plants, Mycelium of phycomycetes - Aseptate and coenocytic, Asexual reproduction in phycomycetes - By zoospores (motile) or by aplanospores (non-motile)

question: Match the following:
column_II: Formed by fusion of two gametes

matches.Zygospore: Formed by fusion of two gametes

answer: Spores of phycomycetes - Endogenously produced in sporangium, Zygospore - Formed by fusion of two gametes, Gametes in phycomycetes - Similar (isogamous) or dissimilar (anisogamous or oogamous), Examples of phycomycetes - Mucor, Rhizopus and Albugo
